TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MessageVersion extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies the versions of SOAP and WS-Addressing associated with a message and its exchange.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MessageVersion contains the versioning information both about the SOAP envelope and the addressing protocol that is used by a message. An instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> is bound upon creation to a specific MessageVersion by passing the version as a parameter into one of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.CreateMessage%2A> overloads.
All the static "get" properties in this class, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap11WSAddressing10%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap12%2A> have enumeration-like semantics. They provide an enumeration of the possible message versions supported by the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/indigo1-md.md)] runtime. A message has an envelope structure and an addressing structure. MessageVersion is just a shortcut for supplying {<xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion>} together.
There are currently two SOAP envelope versions available: SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2. These versions of SOAP are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties. The version of SOAP associated with the MessageVersion can be recovered by using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641) and [SOAP 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96642).
There are currently two versions of WS-Addressing available. The one submitted on 10 August 2004 and the one specified in the WS-Addressing 1.0 protocol. The address version used by the current message version can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property. These versions of WS-Addressing are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties. The WS-Addressing August 2004 is retained as a legacy value. The 10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing is available at [Web Services Addressing (WS-Addressing)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96643). The 17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing 1.0 - Core is available at [Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96644).
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A> provides support for using "plain old XML" (POX)-style messaging. Enabling basic POX messaging is now a matter of setting up an HTTP binding on your service with a text encoder that uses <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>.
Message version objects can be created using specified versions of WS-Addressing and SOAP using one of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.CreateVersion%2A> overloads.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the version of WS-Addressing that is associated with the current message version.
Docs.value: The that is associated with the current message version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks These versions of WS-Addressing are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties. The WS-Addressing August 2004 is retained as a legacy value. The 10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing is available at [Web Services Addressing (WS-Addressing)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96643). The 17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing 1.0 - Core is available at [Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96644).

Docs.summary: Creates a message version object by using WS-Addressing 1.0 and with a specified SOAP version.
Docs.returns: The using the specified version of SOAP and WS-Addressing 1.0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2. There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each version of SOAP that contains the data relevant to its use.

The that indicates the WS-Addressing version.

Docs.returns: The using the specified versions of WS-Addressing and SOAP.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2. There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each version of SOAP that contains the data relevant to its use.
There are currently two versions of WS-Addressing available. One submitted 10 August 2004 and the other submitted August 2005 and referred to as the WS-Addressing 1.0 protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This returns the same object as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap12WSAddressing10%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are currently two SOAP envelope versions available: SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2. These versions of SOAP are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties. The version of SOAP associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> can be recovered by using the Envelope property. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641) and [SOAP 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96642).

Docs.summary: Gets the message version that does not use SOAP or WS-Addressing.
Docs.value: The that does not use SOAP or WS-Addressing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The None consists of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>. This provides support for using "plain old XML" (POX)-style messaging. Enabling basic POX messaging is now a matter of setting up an HTTP binding on your service with a text encoder that uses <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>.
Note that when a service is configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> is set to None, the action header in a request message is removed from the response message. This is consistent with the way ASMX services work.

remarks.format:

- [Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96644)
- [WS-Addressing 1.0 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96647)
- [SOAP 1.1 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641)
